SHORT_DESCR.P: As part of the new Government Quarter project, Statsbygg (the Directorate of Public Construction and Property) wants to develop an industrialised system for inner-walls of timber, that can safeguard the same requirements and services as on-site built walls, as well as streamlining engineering design, ordering and implementation on the construction site. There will be a need to safeguard all aspects related to inner walls, this is for e.g. audio requirements, fire requirements, hidden technical installations and conduits in walls. It is preferable that the industrialised solution appears as a complete and predictable system, with the possibility of handling different interfaces to other building parts as part of the prefabricated construction concept. Furthermore, it is also preferable that the solution can be used across building typologies and building managers, with the potential for reuse.

The Directorate of Public Construction and Property wants to enter into an innovation partnership for development of industrialised inner walls of wood for buildings with a steel or concrete loading system, we call this Smarte lettvegger (Smart non-load bearing walls). He aim of the delivery is to build cheaper, faster and more sustainably through the use of industrialised construction systems. On the basis of the current qualification documentation, the Directorate of Public Construction and Property will choose a maximum of two suppliers or a consortium of companies to participate as innovation partners.

In order to provide relevant suppliers and other stakeholders with more information about the product that is being sought to be developed and the format of the procurement, the Directorate of Public Construction and Property extends an invitation to participate in an information meeting 12 April 2021.
Register for the information meeting by sending an email to emil.rygh@statsbygg.no
The last deadline for registration is 9 April 2021, 15.00.

The Directorate of Public Construction and Property believes that good ideas are developed jointly. On this basis, a ‘matchmaking form’ has been created for those who lack cooperating partners, be it innovators who have good ideas, advisers with expertise, manufacturers with production capacity or other potential contributors, a ‘matchmaking form’ has been created. The purpose of this is to facilitate the establishment of new a new consortium that together can deliver the requested product. Completing the attached form gives consent for the Directorate of Public Construction and Property to share the registered contact information with any cooperating partners. If this is of interest, please complete the following form:
The last deadline to complete the matchmaking form is 14 April 2021.
Questions concerning the matchmaking can be sent to emil.rygh@statsbygg.no, both prior to and after the information meeting.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The contracting authority has an option to purchase a developed solution.

SUITABILITY.P: Tenderers must be registered in a company register, professional register or a trade register in the state where the tenderer is established.
— Foreign tenderers: verification that the company is registered in a company register, professional register or a trade register in the state where the tenderer is established.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: Tenderers must have sufficient economic and financial capacity to fulfil the contract. Creditworthiness with no requirement for guarantees will be sufficient to meet the requirement.
The Directorate of Public Construction and Property will carry out a credit rating of the tenderer.
— tenderers can, in addition, be asked to submit the auditor confirmed annual accounts, alternatively, provide StartBANK ID.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: The tenderer must have qualifications within research and development that is relevant in light of the contracting authority's needs description.
A joint description of up to two relevant products or product ideas must be submitted from suppliers or a combined supplier group.
Text, images and illustration in the description must not exceed six A4 pages.
The description must as a minimum contain the following:
— what was developed, by whom, for whom (contracting authority) which need was covered, date and time frame;
— the development process scope, complexity and end result;

— whether the solutions have been implemented (still in the pilot stage, marketed or sold and being used). If implemented, provide a combined overview of assignment value, date and who the recipient was.
— the project(s) organisation/staffing, including the tenderer’s and possibly other project participants’ specific roles and responsibility in the innovation process;
— how the process was conducted from start to finish and how these experiences can be used in this innovation partnership.
— to what degree the product has contributed to promoting circularity and minimise the total climate and environmental impact.
It is the tenderer’s responsibility to document product or idea description relevance to this assignment through the description.

The tenderer can document experience by referring to competence and experience of the personnel they have at their disposal and can use for this assignment. This applies even if the competence and experience was gained whilst the personnel carried out the service for another supplier.
